title: Finding the Determinant
text: The determinant is given by $$a d-b c$$. This evaluates to $$-6-63$$ which is $$-69$$.

title: Multiplying the Determinant with the Changed Matrix
text: We must modify the matrix into the form $$\begin{bmatrix} d & -b \\ -c & a \end{bmatrix}$$. We now have $$\begin{bmatrix} 2 & -7 \\ -9 & -3 \end{bmatrix}$$. Dividing this matrix by the determinant, we have $$\frac{-1}{69} \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -7 \\ -9 & -3 \end{bmatrix}$$.
